title: Creating a reading list of 20 articles on meaning representation up to 2024 involves selecting a mix of foundational, recent, and influential works in the field. Since I don't have access to articles published after October 2023, I'll include a mix of classic and recent articles up to that point
**"WordNet: An Electronic Lexical Database"** by George A
- A foundational work on lexical databases and semantic networks
**"A Theory of Truth and Semantic Representation"** by Hans Kamp
- Discusses the concept of frames in understanding meaning
**"Distributional Semantics in Linguistic and Cognitive Research"** by Alessandro Lenci
- Explores distributional approaches to semantics
Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding"** by Jacob Devlin et al
- A key paper on transformer models for meaning representation
**"Universal Dependencies: A Cross-Linguistic Perspective"** by Joakim Nivre et al
- Discusses a framework for consistent annotation of grammar across languages
**"The Representation of Meaning in Memory"** by Allan Paivio (1971) - A classic work on dual coding theory
**"Semantic Role Labeling: Past, Present and Future"**
- Reviews the development of semantic role labeling
- Provides an overview of semantic parsing techniques
**"The Meaning of 'Meaning'"** by Hilary Putnam (1975) - A philosophical exploration of meaning
**"Learning Semantic Representations of Users and Products for Document Level Sentiment Classification"** by Ruining He and Julian McAuley
- Discusses sentiment analysis using semantic representations
**"Semantic Memory"** by Endel Tulving
- A foundational paper on the concept of semantic memory
**"The Role of Syntax in Vector Space Models of Compositional Semantics"** by Edward Grefenstette and Mehrnoosh Sadrzadeh
- Explores the integration of syntax in semantic models
- Introduces the concept of the Semantic Web
**"A Survey of Word Embeddings in Natural Language Processing"** by Tomas Mikolov et al
- Discusses the development and application of word embeddings
**"Towards a General Theory of Action and Time"** by James Allen
- Introduces Allen's interval algebra for temporal reasoning
**"The Representation of Meaning in Memory"** by Allan Paivio
- Discusses dual coding theory and its implications for meaning representation
- Explores semantic parsing through paraphrasing techniques
**"The Role of Context in Language Production and Comprehension"**
- Discusses the importance of context in understanding meaning
**"A Survey on Recent Advances in Named Entity Recognition from Deep Learning models"** by Yadav and Bethard
- Reviews advances in named entity recognition, a key aspect of meaning representation
These articles cover a range of topics within meaning representation, from theoretical foundations to practical applications in natural language processing
